item.title: Understanding Nix's lib.fix
item.description: Understanding Nix’s lib.fix — a.k.a. “fixed point combinator” — and then based on it lib.extend, is crucial for understanding various NixOS features, including overlays. Conceptually, lib.fix is a very similar mechanism to rec — it allows defining some attributes of a set “recursively”, using values of other attributes from the same set. The main difference is, that while rec is “eager”, lib.fix is its “lazy” sibling. This magically allows using it to build various powerful features, such as overlays, lib.
